Description: Three fragments of a narrow, loosely woven, dark brown and white/tan hair tape binding consisting of 2 warps 'z'-spun and 'z'-plied and 1 weft 'z'-spun. The selvedge is plain and the weave is plain. The thread count is warp 5 per 10mm and weft 1.5 per 10mm. Three warp ends are missing and probably consisted of cotton or flax yarns. The missing warp yarns alternated with a hair warp.
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p. 63)
Condition: Poor. The object is brittle and soiled with possible loss of weft fibre and breakage of the hair fibres.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.2.109C (excavation object cat. no.)
